page.title: 18Our Village War Grave
page.content: In the{churchyard}near the entrance is our village{war grave.}There lies {Sergeant V.J.T.Allen}of the{Royal Air {Force. Service number 1579427. }In the summer of{1944, June 29th,}Sergeant Allen was flying a Supermarine {Spitfire}fighter, ferrying it from one base to another.His route lay nearby and as his{parents lived in Hope,}he thought he would make a slight{detour, fly over their house & wave to them. He left his flight-path, which was {against regulations,}and did fly low over their house,waving as he went by. But he had{misjudged}his{flying}and, unable to gain enough height,{crashed into a field on the slopes of Dinmore Hill near Bury Farm.Local people saw the accident.Sergeant Allen was{killed {Greater love hath no man than this {That a man lay down his life {For his friends.}Sergeant Allen was 19
